1.title: Traad in America
1.plot: Traad is in America following his dreams- kind of- and living with Ricky who's trying to get his book published. Meanwhile back in Jordan, the Traad family is about to come into some inheritance money.

2.title: Room for Rent
2.plot: Ricky is done with Traad and needs to find a new subject for his book so Traad decides to take matters into his own hands with Geoffrey. Abu Traad has a difficult time finding a renter for Traad's room but Oom Traad has a better solution to their financial woes. Nana keeps scaring away caretakers and Tina is losing patience.

3.title: The Inheritance
3.plot: Oom Traad is now the queen of the castle since she has all this money from her mother and Abu Traad can only grovel. Traad goes behind Ricky's back to ensure that he won't be replaced by a secret meeting with Geoffrey.

4.title: My Sweet Tina
4.plot: Ricky can't wrap his mind around the Traads coming to America but Shaima is hard at work convincing her mama and papa to make the trip- it just might happen.

5.title: Geoffrey and the family
5.plot: Traad discovers that his new crush Tina has been right under his nose at the restaurant. He tries to impress her but Ricky couldn't care less- they need to meet with Geoffrey asap. Meanwhile, the other Traads prepare to travel.

6.title: Travel Arrangements
6.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

7.title: The Flight Booking
7.plot: The Traads were planning on traveling to America but they've hit a roadblock- Traad. He and Ricky scramble to bring them over since Ricky needs them for his book but their trip may not happen after all.

8.title: First Day in America
8.plot: The Traad's arrive in America and lose their daughter immediately because their loser son forgets to pick them up from the airport. Will they and their daughter be swallowed whole by the huge sprawl of Los Angeles?

9.title: Handing out the Tasks
9.plot: The Traad family is finally given their assignments from Ricky for their public service "experiment"- the parents will babysit and the children will pass out fliers. What could possibly go wrong?

10.title: Volunteering
10.plot: Abu Traad and his wife are still looking for the dog, Tina is hoping Traad can save her project so he is frantically trying to whip something up and Ricky checks in on Shaima about the volunteer work.

11.title: Yoga
11.plot: Ricky is taking the Traads for a yoga retreat but Abu and Oom Traad have different ideas of what relaxation looks like. Meanwhile, Tina is filming a short film with Nana and Traad manages to worm himself into the project.

12.title: Shrak Bread
12.plot: Traad needs Ricky's help for a photo shoot but Ricky would rather work on his book, Tina needs Traad's help and Om Traad comes up with a brilliant money making scheme to pay back her sisters.

13.title: The Bread Thief
13.plot: Oom Traad is about to sell her first batch of bread to a hungry list of customers but finds all the bread has been eaten. Everyone is a suspect until the unlikely culprit is finally discovered.

14.title: The Wedding Party
14.plot: Traad has become a full-on diva because of his YouTube video, Ricky has to deal with him while the others are asked to leave the house for a wedding but of course Abu Traad interprets that to mean something entirely different.

15.title: Fame or Family
15.plot: The Abu Traad family awaits a 'gift' from Jeffrey as they wrap things up in America, Ricky tries one more time to act as a family therapist and Traad finally gets his shot at true fame.

1.title: The Stray Bullet
1.plot: Ricky is a young American writer living in Jordan and gets invited to his neighbors, party to celebrate their son's graduation. After a miscommunication at the fiesta, he tries again at a funeral but that did not end well at all either.

2.title: Time Is Money
2.plot: Ricky tried to fit a date in with Cherry and a meeting with Abu Traad into the same night. Little did he know that Eastern times are not based on a clock but rather on a feeling. Needless to say, tempers run hot in this head-on collision of cultures.

3.title: Conspiracy Theory
3.plot: Abu Traad was watching his neighbor and starts to feel suspicious that this guy is a terrorist. He ropes in the help of Traad and Ricky to be the heroic sleuth he's convinced that he is and naturally they encounter some problems.

4.title: Traad in Love
4.plot: Traad's heart becomes enamored with a neighbor girl but his father says no. He runs away for some meditative counseling from an ill-trained Ricky while his family is left wondering where he has gone.

5.title: Trip to the Dead Sea
5.plot: Ricky had plans for a Turkish bath but the Traads changed them by inviting him to the Dead Sea with them. His first 'family' trip turns out to be much different than he expected.

6.title: The Costume Party
6.plot: For the first time, the roles are reversed as the Traads along with their friends Abu Arif and his son go to Ricky's place for an American costume party. Needless to say, cultures collide.

7.title: In Prison
7.plot: Traad doesn't tell Ricky the laws during Ramadan so they both end up in prison. Inside they share a cell with the roughest thugs in Jordan and their only hope is Abu Traad bailing them out.

8.title: The Ten Rules of Driving
8.plot: Ricky is continually late for class so he needs to get a driver's license. He asks Traad to teach him the rules of the Arab roads and Traad happily obliges to give him a crash course.

9.title: Ricky in Hospital
9.plot: Ricky tries to prove how tough he is and shoots himself in the foot, literally. While he may be accustomed to the privacy of Western hospital wards, the Traad family is used to smothering their wounded with food, gifts and quality time. He wonders if his foot will heal before he dies from lack of privacy.

10.title: In the Gym
10.plot: Traad wins a free membership to a gym by Ricky's dumb luck. Together with Abu Traad, they venture to exercise but the modern equipment and clash of cultures proves a dangerous cocktail for all three.

1.title: Love Gone Awry
1.plot: After a year in the Middle East, Ricky has taken on some habits his American girlfriend isn't so impressed with. Abu Traad is having some issue of his own with his bride and Traad falls in love with America and himself.

2.title: Homesick Rick
2.plot: Ricky's missing the comforts of home, Abu Trad is alone and Traad wants to impress a girl. The only way to cure all of these ails is of course the hot tub, massage and then trying to shoot each other at paintball.

3.title: Where Is Oom Traad?
3.plot: Ricky discovers that he owes Uncle Sam some back taxes so he gets a job as a mechanic. Meanwhile, Traad is getting in trouble with Arif who's secretly talking with Shaima as Abu Traad stews in his loneliness. Oom Traad is sorely missed and needed.

4.title: The Dating Game
4.plot: Traad reads Ricky's mind i.e. his emails, and sees that he's ready to get back into the dating game. On their own initiative , Traad and his father ready their American neighbor for properly engaging in finding a lady in the Arab world.

5.title: A Tangled Mess
5.plot: After the blind date debacle, Ricky tries to clean things up on his own. Little does he know, the woman he's shunning is the apple of Abu Traad's eye. Traad doesn't notice because he's too wrapped up in welcoming his new exchange student Jessica at the airport.

6.title: Out with the Old, In with the New
6.plot: A beautiful woman turns Ricky's head at the mall, Abu Traad is trying to take Reem to the ruins, and Traad scares Jessica away. And in the end, someone makes a surprise entrance.

7.title: The Blue Pill Part 1
7.plot: Abu Traad is on thin ice now that Oom Traad is back. He needs to be at his best so he and Traad take the women to a soccer game. Meanwhile, Ricky is heartbroken and runs off to find some peace only to get into more trouble.

8.title: Back to Prison Part 2
8.plot: Ricky tried to join a gang but doesn't quite have what it takes. Abu Traad is hoping to score after the soccer game but Traad gets into some trouble so his father has to fix his mess first.

9.title: Ricky Finds Love
9.plot: Ricky is determined to not let Salma get away and he goes to great lengths to get her back, just as Abu Traad turns to social media to win back his wife. Meanwhile, Traad is looking for Jessica who ran away.

10.title: Shame on Shaima
10.plot: Abu Traad thinks Shaima is up to no good and he's enlisted Abu Arif to help him find out. Traad and Lisa babysit and it turns ugly quick and Ricky wants to take it to the next level with Salma. Is she ready?

11.title: The Condition
11.plot: Ricky needs to get Salma's family to agree to their marriage but the father places a condition on him that will be hard to fulfill. Abu Traad still can't get time alone with his wife and Traad is asked by Salma's cousin to sabotage the engagement.

12.title: The Trip Part 1
12.plot: Ricky, Jessica and the Traad men plan a last minute trip to Petra while Abu Arif stays back at the American's apartment for some time away from his wife. What could possibly go wrong?

13.title: The Trip Part 2
13.plot: The band of traveling armpits- Ricky, Jessica, Abu Traad and son- find themselves in the middle of the dessert, far from their intended destination. After splitting up into two groups in order to find help, the only thing they discover is themselves in deep trouble.

14.title: The Bachelor Party
14.plot: The official ceremony of getting Salma's father's approval begins with Abu Traad proudly serving as Ricky's 'father' while his real father and family sit and wonder what is happening all around them. Meanwhile, Traad senses a threat to his love for Jessica.

15.title: The Wedding
15.plot: The day of the wedding has arrived and just as everything seems to be going to plan, Ricky and his bride get separated from the rest of the wedding party. In the end, will it all come together? Will Oom Traad return? Will Traad get his dance with Jessica? Will Ricky really get married?

1.title: Taxi Driving License
1.plot: Ricky is now divorced and depressed. He tries to pull himself up by the bootstraps but Traad's failure as a driver and Abu Traad's failure as a father keep getting in the way of his recovery.

2.title: The New Mobile Phone
2.plot: Traad wins a phone but his father takes it and Ricky needs an internet connection immediately. Shaima has a secret admirer outside her window and she chooses to meet him face to face.

3.title: Egg Nights Part1
3.plot: A new neighbor is in the building and Ricky wants to take her out for coffee but Traad and his family are too busy to help him since they're looking for the bandit who's throwing eggs at all of their cars.

4.title: Egg Nights Part 2
4.plot: Things heat up as the egg bandit is on a rampage and cannot be stopped, Ricky is trying to connect with a new female neighbor and Traad and Shaima can't stop the littler girl they're babysitting from cursing.

5.title: Gone with the Wind
5.plot: Abu Aref is nosing into the building's business and see Shaima chatting with a boy, Abu Traad is hanging clothes and Ricky and Traad have found something precious by the tree.

6.title: Abu Shameh
6.plot: Ricky is working on something special for the entire Traad family but they think he's up to something shrewd and regardless, they're bust preparing for the mayor to arrive with Abu Arif.

7.title: The Youtube Star
7.plot: The boys need money and the best way to do that is to film Abu Traad and put him on YouTube. Oom Traad is missing so he takes on the household chores and provides terrific fodder for the video masses.

8.title: The Rules of Eid
8.plot: The Eid is here and Ricky has been invited to celebrate with the Traads so Traad teaches him the rules as Shaima breaks the rules of her hairdresser. It doesn't end well.

9.title: Sit Down Oom Traad
9.plot: The building is holding elections for the new "Head of Community". Abu Traad thinks that he has it in the bag but Ricky and others show him what true democracy is - kind of.

10.title: White Lie
10.plot: Traad and Ricky try a taxi business and Shaima has a suitor to come ask her hand in marriage. Little Aya is being taught by her father the value of a white lie- a white lie that darkens ever so quickly.

11.title: The Immigrant
11.plot: The men are going to make easy money by picking up Abu Aref's cousin from the airport and show him a good time and Shaima has a sure thing in a new suitor. Unfortunately, reality sinks in quickly.

12.title: Thanksgiving
12.plot: Every year Ricky starts to miss America, especially during Thanksgiving. His only hope for happiness is to make friends with the new female neighbor. Abu Traad and family plan to intervene in both matters.

13.title: Who is Oom Arif?
13.plot: Abu Arif claims his wife can make better food then Oom Traad. The men challenge him to have her make them mensaf so they'll finally get a chance to meet this mysterious Oom Arif.

14.title: The Biggest Loser
14.plot: Abu Arif and Abu Traad want to see who can lose the most weight so they have a competition. Ricky starts his own food truck business and ropes in Traad to help with the coffee.

15.title: Good Bye Ricky
15.plot: The time has come for Ricky to return back to America. After a final meal together with everyone, he heads to the airport where Traad will meet him and fly to America as well.

locations: Hollywood Boulevard & Highland Avenue, Hollywood, Los Angeles, California, USA::(Filming City)
Venice Canals, Venice, Los Angeles, California, USA::(outdoor filming)
imdb.plot outline: A struggling American writer moves to Amman, Jordan to chronicle his life there and publish a book. His Jordanian upstairs neighbors take him in as their own and they turn out to be more than he can handle. For four seasons, their ongoing misunderstandings, blunders and pettiness lead to a million laughs and a few steps toward peace in the Middle East.
imdb.title: My American Neighbor
plot: A struggling American writer moves to Amman, Jordan to chronicle his life there and publish a book. His Jordanian upstairs neighbors take him in as their own and they turn out to be more than he can handle. For four seasons, their ongoing misunderstandings, blunders and pettiness lead to a million laughs and a few steps toward peace in the Middle East.::Brett Weer
